meanings.sent1: The longish hallway seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent2: She wore a longish dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The longish line at the grocery store made him reconsider his shopping plans.
meanings.sent4: The longish shadows of the trees danced in the evening light.
meanings.sent5: The longish road ahead was filled with unknown adventures.

meanings.sent1: The longish bridge connected the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent2: The longish journey took them through valleys and mountains.
meanings.sent3: The longish phone cord allowed her to pace around the room while talking.
meanings.sent4: The longish branches of the tree reached out towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The longish fence marked the boundary of the property.

meanings.definition: Lasting or taking a long time.
meanings.sent1: The longish meeting seemed to drag on endlessly.
meanings.sent2: The longish winter made everyone yearn for spring.
meanings.sent3: The longish movie had him checking his watch multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The longish wait for the bus tested her patience.
meanings.sent5: The longish project required careful planning and dedication.
